Modern-day Kyrgyzstan has sizeable minority groups such as the Uzbeks and Dungans. These groups were historically conquered by Manas, and hence, the current flag does not sit well with some of them.

tags: cambodia blue red white horizontal stripes building
name: Cambodia
symbolism:
Angkor Wat: Integrity, justice and heritage.
Blue: Liberty, cooperation and brotherhood.
Red: Bravery.
funfacts:
Since around 1850, the Cambodian flag has featured a depiction of Angkor Wat in the centre.
The flag is one of only a few flags to feature a building.

tags: kiribati red white blue yellow sun bird animal waves
name: Kiribati
symbolism:
Three white waves: The Pacific Ocean and the three archipelagoes (Gilbert, Phoenix and Line Islands).
The sun and its 17 rays: Kiribati's position on the equator and the 16 Gilbert Islands and Banaba.
Frigatebird: Command over the sea, freedom, and dance patterns.
funfacts: The badge was designed by Sir Arthur Grimble in 1931 for the Gilbert and Ellice Islands British colony.

tags: comoros green yellow white red blue triangle horizontal stripes moon star pan-african
name: Comoros
symbolism:
Stripes and stars: The four islands of the nation; yellow is for Mohéli, white is for Mayotte (claimed by Comoros but administered by France), red is for Anjouan, and blue is for Grande Comore.
Star, moon and green: The main religion, Islam.
funfacts: In its constitution, the government of the Comoros refers to the insignia as "l'emblème national", or the "national emblem", though it is understood to actually represent a flag.

tags: saint kitts nevis green yellow black white red triangle star stripes diagonal
name: Saint Kitts and Nevis
symbolism:
Green: The fertile land.
Red: The fight for freedom against slavery and colonialism.
Yellow: The sunshine the islands enjoy all year round.
Black: The people's African origins.
The two stars: Hope and liberty.
funfacts:
Although the flag utilises the colours of the Pan-Africanist movement, the symbolism behind them is interpreted differently.
A national competition was held in the early 1980s to choose a new flag. The winning design by student Edris Lewis was one of 258 entries.

tags: north korea blue white red horizontal stripes star circle
name: North Korea
symbolism:
Red star: Revolutionary traditions but is also a universal symbol of Communism and socialism.
Red: The patriotism and determination of the Korean people.
White: The unity of the Korean nation and its culture.
Blue: The desire to fight for independence, peace, friendship, and international unity.
funfacts: The flag is banned from public use in South Korea due to its association with the ruling North Korean regime, although some exceptions for the usage of the flag exist.

tags: south korea white black red blue circle stripes
name: South Korea
symbolism:
White: Peace and purity, a traditional color in Korean culture.
Circle (taegeuk): Balance in the universe; the red half represents positive cosmic forces, and the blue half represents the opposing negative cosmic forces.
The trigrams: Movement and harmony as fundamental principles. Each trigram represents one of the four classical elements.
funfacts:
The South Korean flag is considered by a large part of the country's citizens to represent the "Korean race" rather than solely the South Korean state; consequently flag desecration by the country's citizens is rare when compared to other countries.
The taegeuk is used in Korean Shamanism, Confucianism, Daoism and Buddhism.

tags: kuwait green white red black horizontal stripes pan-arab
name: Kuwait
symbolism:
Red (Hashemite dynasty): Courage, bravery, hardiness, strength, and unity.
White (Umayyad dynasty): Cleanliness, honesty, peace, and purity.
Green (Fatimid dynasty): Prosperity, hope, joy, love, and optimism.
Black (Abbasid dynasty): Defeating enemies and strength of mind.
funfacts: The colors are those used in the Arab Revolt and referred to as the Pan-Arab colours.

tags: cayman islands white blue red cross british text star animal waves
name: Cayman Islands
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Union Jack, see United Kingdom.
Three green stars: The three inhabited Islands; Grand Cayman, Little Cayman and Cayman Brac.
Gold lion: Britain.
Turtle: The Caymans' seafaring history.
The rope: Traditional thatch-rope industry.
Pineapple: Jamaica.
funfacts: The islands' motto, "He hath founded it upon the seas", is printed at the bottom of the shield. This line, a verse from Psalm 24 Verse 2, acknowledges the Caymans' Christian heritage, as well as its ties to the sea.

tags: kazakhstan blue yellow circle sun bird animal
name: Kazakhstan
symbolism:
Blue: The peace, freedom, cultural, and ethnic unity of Kazakh people including the various Turkic people that make up the present-day population.
Sun: A source of life and energy. It is also a symbol of wealth and abundance; the sun's rays are a symbol of the steppe's grain which is the basis of abundance and prosperity.
Eagle: Independence, freedom and flight to the future.
Pattern: A national ornamental pattern called "koshkar-muiz" (the horns of the ram).
funfacts: Probably inspired by the Belarus flag created when flags of distinctive designs were first being developed for the Soviet Union republics.

tags: laos red blue white horizontal stripes circle
name: Laos
symbolism:
White disk: The unity of the Lao people and a full moon against the Mekong River.
Red: The blood shed by the Lao people on both banks of the Mekong River in their struggle for freedom and independence from the French.
Blue: The Mekong River itself, a symbol of the nation's prosperity.
funfacts: It is one of the three flags of a currently communist country (the others being Cuba and Nepal) that does not use any communist symbolism.

tags: lebanon red white green horizontal stripes vegetation
name: Lebanon
symbolism:
Cedar tree: Inspired by the mountains of Lebanon cedar (Cedrus libani). The Cedar is also a symbol of Maronite Christians and has its origin in many biblical references.
White: The snow as a symbol of purity and peace.
Red: The Lebanese blood shed to preserve the country against the successive invaders.
funfacts:
It was adopted just prior to independence from France in 1943. Seeking independence, the actual flag was first drawn by member of parliament Henri Pharaon.
The cedar of Lebanon is mentioned 77 times in the Bible, especially in the book Psalms chapter 92 verse 13 where it says that "The righteous shall flourish like the palm tree, He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon".

tags: saint lucia blue white black yellow mountain triangle
name: Saint Lucia
symbolism:
Blue: The sky and the sea, specifically the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea.
Black and white: The harmonious relationship between the black and white races.
Yellow: The sunshine and prosperity.
Triangles: Unity and the Pitons, which are twin volcanic cones located in the southwest part of the island.
funfacts: The Pitons (Gros Piton and Petit Piton) are a national symbol of Saint Lucia.

tags: liechtenstein blue red yellow horizontal stripes crown
name: Liechtenstein
symbolism:
Blue: The sky.
Red: The "evening fires" that are lit inside houses throughout the country.
Crown: The unity of the people and their prince.
funfacts: The crown was added to the flag in 1937 after the country found out, at the Summer Olympics held the previous year, that their flag was identical to the civil flag of Haiti.

tags: sri lanka yellow green orange red maroon vertical stripes animal weapon vegetation
name: Sri Lanka
symbolism:
The lion and the maroon: The Sinhala ethnicity.
Yellow border and four bo leaves: The concepts of mettā, karuṇā, muditā and upekshā respectively.
Stripes: The country's two largest minorities; orange for Tamils and green for Muslims (Moors).
There are more details with its own symbolism, the full list can be found by following the Wikipedia link below.
funfacts: The symbol of a lion in Sri Lankan heraldry dates back to 486 BC, when Vijaya, the first King of Sri Lanka, arrived on the island from India and brought with him a standard depicting a lion.

tags: liberia red white blue horizontal stripes star
name: Liberia
symbolism:
Eleven stripes: The signatories of the Liberian Declaration of Independence.
Red and white: Courage and moral excellence.
White star: The first independent republic in Africa.
Blue square: The African continent.
funfacts:
The Liberian flag is modeled after and resembles the United States flag because Liberia was founded, colonized, established, and controlled by free people of color and formerly enslaved black people from the United States and the Caribbean.
Since Liberia offers registration under its flag, shipping companies registers boats as Liberian to avoid taxes and restrictions that other countries enforce. It is the second most popular flag of convenience after the flag of Panama.
The only nation other than Ethiopia to remain independent during the Scramble for Africa.

tags: lesotho blue white green hat horizontal stripes
name: Lesotho
symbolism:
Blue: The sky or rain.
White: Peace.
Green: Prosperity.
Black Basotho hat: The native people of Lesotho and the black people of the nation.
funfacts:
The design is intended to reflect a state that is at peace both internally and with its only neighbour South Africa.
Lesotho has had the ideology of peace since the ages of King Moshoeshoe I (1822-1870).

tags: lithuania yellow green red horizontal stripes
name: Lithuania
symbolism:
Yellow: The sun and prosperity.
Green: The forests, the countryside, liberty, and hope.
Red: The blood and bravery of those who have died for Lithuania.
funfacts:
It is not known who originally suggested the yellow, green, and red colors, but the idea is usually attributed to Lithuanian exiles living elsewhere in Europe or in the United States during the 19th century. These three colors were frequently used in folk weavings and traditional dresses.
Under the National Flag Law, the state flag is permanently hoisted at three locations: the Royal Palace of Lithuania, Trakai Island Castle, and the grounds of the Vytautas the Great War Museum in Kaunas.

tags: luxembourg red white blue horizontal stripes
name: Luxembourg
symbolism:
Red: Revolution and power, as well as determination and courage of the people.
White: Harmony, peace and innocence of the people.
Blue: Perseverance and determination.
funfacts:
It is almost identical to the flag of the Netherlands, except that it is longer and its light blue stripe and red stripe are a lighter shade. But there is no documented relationship between the flags.
Luxembourg had no flag until 1830, during the Belgian Revolution, when patriots were urged to display the national colours.
The red, white, and light blue colours were derived from the coat of arms of the House of Luxembourg.

tags: latvia red white horizontal stripes
name: Latvia
symbolism: Red: The readiness of the Latvians to give the blood from their hearts for freedom and their willingness to defend their liberty.
funfacts: An alternative interpretation, according to one legend, is that a Latvian leader was wounded in battle, and the edges of the white sheet in which he was wrapped were stained by his blood. This story is similar to the legend of the origins of the flag of Austria.

tags: libya red black green white horizontal stripes star moon pan-arab
name: Libya
symbolism:
Red: The blood sacrificed for the freedom of Libya.
Black: The dark days that Libyans lived under the occupation of the Italians.
Green: Primary wealth, agriculture and the future prosperity of the country.
Crescent moon: The beginning of the lunar month according to the Muslim calendar, meant as a reminder of the migration story of the Prophet Mohammed to spread Islam and its teachings.
Star: Hope, the beauty of aim and the light of the belief in God and the country.
funfacts:
The colors are those used in the Arab Revolt and referred to as the Pan-Arab colours.
Under Muammar Gaddafi's rule, Libya had a red-white-black flag from 1969 to 1977, and it was replaced by the all-green flag from 1977 to 2011, during which it was the only flag in the world to have one color and no design.

tags: morocco red green star triangle
name: Morocco
symbolism:
Red: Hardiness, bravery, strength and valour.
Green: Love, joy, wisdom, peace and hope as well as the color of Islam.
Pentagram: The seal of Solomon and the five branches represent the pillars of Islam or alternatively; love, truth, peace, freedom and justice.
funfacts: Red has considerable historic significance in Morocco, proclaiming the descent from royal Alaouite dynasty. This ruling house was associated with the Islamic prophet Muhammad via Fatimah, the wife of Ali, the fourth Muslim Caliph.

tags: monaco red white horizontal stripes
name: Monaco
symbolism:
Red: The flesh of the human body.
White: Purity in spiritual life.
funfacts:
The flag of Monaco is nearly identical to the flag of Indonesia but it is believed to be purely coincidental.
The flag of Poland is also similar to that of Monaco, but with the colours reversed.

tags: moldova blue yellow red vertical stripes star moon bird animal shield cross vegetation
name: Moldova
symbolism:
Blue: Liberty.
Yellow: Justice.
Red: Fraternity.
The eagle holds a Christian Orthodox cross, olive branch (peace) and a shield with traditional Moldovan symbols like the auroch and rose.
funfacts:
It is very similar to the flag of Romania, reflecting the two countries' national and cultural affinity.
The design is also similar to the flags of Andorra and Chad but that is believed to be coincidental.

tags: montenegro red yellow bird cross animal
name: Montenegro
symbolism: Two-headed eagle: Unity or close connections between state and church.
funfacts: Montenegro previously had the widest flag in the world at a ratio of 1:3.

tags: saint martin blue white red vertical stripes
name: Saint Martin
symbolism: For symbolism regarding the French flag, see France.

tags: madagascar white red green horizontal stripes
name: Madagascar
symbolism:
Red and white: The colors of the Merina kingdom.
Green: The color of the Hova, the largest class of peasant commoners, who played a significant role in anti-French agitation and the independence movement.
funfacts: The flag was adopted two years before the independence from France.

tags: marshall islands blue white orange stripes triangle star sun diagonal
name: Marshall Islands
symbolism:
Blue: The pacific ocean.
Orange and white stripes: The equator, sunrise and sunset, as well as peace and courage.
Star: The country's location as a Northern Hemisphere archipelago and its 24 points represent the number of electoral districts, while the four elongated points represent the principal cultural centers of Majuro, Jaluit, Wotje and Ebeye.
funfacts:
Designed by Emlain Kabua, who served as the first First Lady of the republic.
It is the national flag with the most points on a star, at 24.

tags: north macedonia red yellow sun triangle circle diagonal
name: North Macedonia
symbolism: The sun represents the "new sun of Liberty" referred to in "Denes nad Makedonija", the national anthem of North Macedonia.
funfacts: The previous flag featured the "Vergina Sun" but Greece considers the Vergina Sun to be a Greek symbol and imposed a year-long economic embargo in order to force the then Republic of Macedonia to remove it from its flag, resulting in the current design.

tags: mali green yellow red vertical stripes pan-african
name: Mali
symbolism:
Green: Fertility of the land.
Gold: Purity and mineral wealth.
Red: The blood shed for independence from the French.
funfacts:
The colours were derived from those of the flag of Ghana, following the Pan-African movement.
The flag is the reverse of the flag of Guinea.

tags: myanmar burma red green yellow white star horizontal stripes
name: Myanmar
symbolism:
Yellow: Solidarity.
Green: Peace, tranquility and lush greenery.
Red: Courage and determination.
White star: The significance of the union of the country.
funfacts: Green, yellow, and red are also considered Pan-African colours, leading commentators to note that the new flag looked distinctly "African" and even that it was being confused for the flag of an African country.

tags: mongolia red blue yellow vertical stripes circle
name: Mongolia
symbolism:
Blue: The eternal blue sky.
Red: Thriving for eternity.
Soyombo symbol: Fire, sun, moon, earth, water, and the Taijitu symbol representing the duality of yin and yang.
funfacts: The Soyombo symbol is a special character in the Soyombo alphabet invented by Zanabazar in 1686. It serves as a national symbol of Mongolia, to be found on the Flag of Mongolia, the Emblem of Mongolia, and on many other official documents.

tags: macau green white star horizontal stripes vegetation waves
name: Macau
symbolism:
Stars: Referencing the flag of People's Republic of China, symbolising the relationship Macau has with its sovereign state.
Lotus: The floral emblem of Macau.
Bridge: One of the most recognisable landmarks for the territory, The Governor Nobre de Carvalho Bridge linking the Macau Peninsula and the island of Taipa.
Water: Macau's position as a port and its role played in the territory.
funfacts: Prior to the handover of Macau to the People's Republic of China by the Portuguese Republic in 1999, Macau officially used only the Portuguese flag, in contrast to Hong Kong, which, under British rule, used a defaced Blue Ensign as its flag.

tags: northern mariana islands blue white grey circle star
name: Northern Mariana Islands
symbolism:
Star: The United States.
Latte stone: The Chamorros, the indigenous people of the Mariana Islands.
Mwarmwar: a decorative wreath representing the Carolinians.
Blue: The Pacific Ocean and the Mariana Trench.
funfacts: A latte stone is a pillar (up to 5 meters tall) capped by a hemispherical stone capital with the flat side facing up. Used as building supports by the ancient Chamorro people.

tags: martinique green red black triangle horizontal
name: Martinique
symbolism: The Martiniquais independence movement.
funfacts:
Known as the "Rouge-vert-noir" ("red-green-black").
The flag was the runner-up in the official competition of finding an official flag of Martinique but eventually won after the winner was withdrawn after plagiarism accusations.

tags: mauritania green yellow star moon horizontal stripes pan-african
name: Mauritania
symbolism:
Green, star and crescent moon: Islam, Mauritania's state religion.
Yellow: The sands of the Sahara desert.
Red: The efforts and sacrifices that the people of Mauritania will keep consenting, to the price of their blood, to defend their territory.
funfacts: Although the flag utilises the colours of the Pan-Africanist movement, the symbolism behind them is interpreted differently.

tags: montserrat blue white red cross british human
name: Montserrat
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Union Jack, see United Kingdom.
Person with harp: Éirinn, the female personification of Ireland, with a golden harp which is also symbol of Ireland.
funfacts: The Irish symbolism of the flag is due to the nation's Irish ancestry.

tags: malta red white vertical stripes cross animal text
name: Malta
symbolism:
Red and white most likely represents the flag of the Knights of Malta, a white cross on a red field.
George cross: It was awarded to the island of Malta by King George VI so as to "bear witness to the heroism and devotion of its people" during the great siege they underwent in the early part of World War II and was incorporated into the flag in 1943.
funfacts: A popular myth of its origin is that Roger I of Sicily tore off part of his chequered red-and-white flag to give to the local Christians fighting with him so they could be recognized against the Arabic defenders.

tags: mauritius red blue yellow green horizontal stripes pan-african
name: Mauritius
symbolism:
Red: The struggle for freedom and independence.
Blue: The Indian Ocean, in which Mauritius is situated.
Yellow: The new light of independence.
Green: The agriculture of Mauritius and its colour throughout the 12 months of the year.
funfacts:
In an attempt to unite the nation, especially following the deadly and divisive 1965 Mauritius race riots and 1968 Mauritian riots, the colours also represent the main political parties at the time.
Although the flag utilises the colours of the Pan-Africanist movement, the symbolism behind them is interpreted differently.

tags: maldives red green white moon
name: Maldives
symbolism:
Red: The boldness of the nation's heroes, and their willingness to sacrifice their every drop of blood in defense of their country.
Green: Peace and prosperity.
White crescent moon: The Islamic faith of the state and authorities.
funfacts: Designed by Abdul Majeed Didi, Sultan of the Maldives from 1944 to 1952 and has been described as "the father of the modern Maldives".

tags: malawi black red green horizontal stripes sun pan-african
name: Malawi
symbolism:
Rising sun: The dawn of hope and freedom for the continent of Africa (when the flag was created, more countries in Africa were gaining independence from European rule).
31 rays of the sun: The fact that Malawi was the 31st African nation at the time of its independence.
Black: The indigenous people of the continent.
Red: The blood of their struggle.
Green: Nature.
funfacts: It resembles the Pan-African flag designed by Marcus Garvey's Universal Negro Improvement Association and a version of it (with a full white sun) was adopted by Malawi in 2010 through endorsement of the Malawi president Bingu wa Mutharika. The decision was reverted in 2012 since a majority of the population saw it as an illegitimate flag, perceiving its adoption as undemocratic.

tags: mexico green white red vertical stripes bird animal vegetation ribbon flag
name: Mexico
symbolism:
Coat of arms: Based on the Aztec symbol for Tenochtitlan (now Mexico City), the center of the Aztec empire.
Colors: First used in Mexico by the Army of the Three Guarantees, in the end of the Mexican War of Independence against Spain, fighting for the three decrees it was meant to defend; religion, independence and unity.
funfacts: It is very similar to the Italian flag, with a slight difference in the shades and proportion.

tags: malaysia blue red white yellow horizontal stripes moon star
name: Malaysia
symbolism:
The 14 stripes: The equal status in the federation of the 13 member states and the federal territories.
Blue: The unity of the Malaysian people.
14-point star (Federal Star): The unity between the states and territories.
The crescent moon: Islam, the country's state religion.
Yellow: The royal colour of the Malay rulers.
funfacts:
The design of the flag is based on those of two existing flags, the flag of Majapahit and the flag of Johor, where the stripes from the flag of Majapahit were incorporated together with the canton containing the crescent moon and star from the flag of Johor.
The Federal Star is similar in concept of Australia's Commonwealth Star in that it symbolises the unity of states in the Malaysian federation and its Federal government.

tags: mozambique green white black yellow red triangle horizontal stripes star weapon tool pan-african
name: Mozambique
symbolism:
Green: The riches of the land.
White: Peace.
Black: The African continent.
Yellow: The country's minerals.
Red: The struggle for independence.
Coat of arms: The rifle represents defence and vigilance. The open book represents the importance of education. The hoe represents the country's agriculture. The star represents Marxism and internationalism.
funfacts:
It is one of the few national flags among UN member states that feature a firearm, along with those of Guatemala and Haiti.
The flag is based on the flag of the Mozambican Liberation Front (FRELIMO), the leading political party in Mozambique.

tags: namibia blue white red green yellow triangle sun circle stripes pan-african diagonal
name: Namibia
symbolism:
Red: The country's most important resource, its people, and their heroism as well as determination to build a future of equal opportunity for all.
White: Peace, unity, tranquility, and harmony.
Green: Vegetation and agricultural resources.
Blue: The clear Namibian sky and the Atlantic Ocean, the country's precious water resources and rain.
Sun: Life and energy.
funfacts:
Designed by Fred Brownell (South African state herald) who also designed the flag of South Africa.
It was adopted on 21 March 1990 upon independence from South Africa.

tags: new caledonia blue red green yellow black horizontal stripes circle sun
name: New Caledonia
symbolism:
Blue: The sky and more importantly the ocean surrounding New Caledonia.
Red: The blood shed by the Kanaks in their struggle for independence, socialism, and unity.
Green: The land itself and by extension the ancestors buried within it.
Yellow disc: The sun and the symbol upon it consists of a flèche faitière, a carved rooftop spire that adorns Kanak houses and represents the spirit of Kanak culture.
funfacts:
It is also the flag of the Kanak and Socialist National Liberation Front (FLNKS), a political party favoring independence for New Caledonia (an overseas territory of France), thus a highly controversial emblem.
Two flags represent New Caledonia, the Kanak flag (pictured above) and the flag of France.

tags: niger orange white green horizontal stripes circle
name: Niger
symbolism:
Orange stripe: The northern regions of the Sahara Desert.
White: Purity and the French-descended small white minority.
Green: Hope and the fertile regions of southern Niger.
Orange circle: The sun and independence.
funfacts: It is similar to the Flag of India, although the ratio, shade of orange, and symbol in the center differ.

tags: norfolk island green white vertical stripes vegetation
name: Norfolk Island
symbolism: Norfolk Island pine: Endemic to Norfolk Island and hence an important symbol.
funfacts: It is similar to the flag of Nigeria.

tags: nigeria green white vertical stripes
name: Nigeria
symbolism:
Green: Natural wealth.
White: Peace and unity.
funfacts: The flag is an adaptation of the winning entry from Michael Taiwo Akinkunmi (23-year-old student in London at the time) in a competition held in 1959.

tags: nicaragua blue white horizontal stripes mountain waves hat text name
name: Nicaragua
symbolism:
Triangle: Equality.
Five volcanoes: The original member states of the Federal Republic of Central America (Costa Rica, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, and Nicaragua).
Phrygian cap of Liberty: National freedom.
Rays of the sun and the rainbow: The bright future to come.
funfacts:
It is based and inspired on the flag of the Federal Republic of Central America and flag of Argentina.
The presence of a rainbow in the coat of arms makes the flag of Nicaragua one of only two flags of a sovereign state to include the color purple, alongside the flag of Dominica.

tags: netherlands red white blue horizontal stripes
name: Netherlands
symbolism:
Red: Bravery, strength and valor.
White: Honesty and peace.
Blue: Loyalty, justice and vigilance.
funfacts:
Based on the Prince's Flag which is based on the Flag of Prince William of Orange-Nassau.
The previously orange stripe was replaced by red because orange was more likely to fade out at the time.
The flag of Netherlands is probably the oldest tricolour flag in continuous use and inspired the Russian and French flags.

tags: norway blue red white cross
name: Norway
symbolism:
Cross: Christianity.
Red and blue: Denmark and Sweden respectively, the former and present union partners.
funfacts:
It was designed in 1821 by Fredrik Meltzer, a member of the parliament.
In 1844, a union mark combining Norwegian and Swedish colours was placed at the hoist of both countries' flags. The badge was jokingly called Sildesalaten ("the herring salad") because of its jumble of colours and resemblance to a popular dish on the breakfast tables of both countries.

tags: nepal red blue white triangle star sun moon
name: Nepal
symbolism:
Red: The bravery of Nepali people and it also represents the color of the rhododendron, Nepal's national flower.
Blue: Peace.
Moon: The cool weather of the Himalayas and the calm demeanor and purity of spirit of the Nepali people.
Sun: The heat and the high temperature of the southern lowlands (Terai) and the Nepali peoples fierce resolve.
funfacts:
Until 1962, the flag's emblems, both the sun and the crescent moon, had human faces, but they were removed to modernize the flag.
It is one of the three flags of a currently communist country that does not use any communist symbolism (the others being Cuba and Laos).

tags: nauru blue yellow white horizontal stripes star
name: Nauru
symbolism:
Blue: The Pacific Ocean.
Gold stripe: The Equator.
Stripe and star: The location of the island in the Pacific Ocean just south of the Equator.
Twelve points on the star: The island's twelve original tribes.
White: The phosphate which was a major natural resource of the island nation.
funfacts: Some believe that the separation into two equal parts recalls the saga that the first inhabitants were to have been brought to Earth from two boulders.

tags: niue yellow blue white red cross british circle star
name: Niue
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Union Jack, see United Kingdom.
Union Jack: The protection granted by the United Kingdom in 1900.
Yellow: The bright sunshine of Niue and the warm feelings of the Niuean people towards New Zealand and her people.
Four small stars: The Southern Cross constellation represents New Zealand, which took over responsibility and administration of Niue in 1901.
Blue disc with large star: The deep blue sea surrounding the self-governing island of Niue.
funfacts:
It is very unusual for a flag based on a British ensign design, in having not only a yellow background, but also an edited Union Jack.
It was designed by Patricia Rex, the wife of the first Premier of the island; Robert Rex.

tags: new zealand blue white red cross british star
name: New Zealand
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Union Jack, see United Kingdom.
Four red stars: The Southern Cross constellation.
funfacts:
In Māori mythology the Southern Cross is identified as "Māhutonga", an aperture in Te Ikaroa (the Milky Way) through which storm winds escaped.
Replacing the flag with a new one has been a continouous debate in the country since 1973. In the last referendum about it (2016) the country voted to keep the existing flag by 57% to 43%.

tags: oman red white green weapon horizontal
name: Oman
symbolism:
White: Peace and the Imam, the religious leader of Oman.
Green: The Jabal al-Akdar, or "Green Mountains," which lie toward the north of the country.
Red: Referencing other Gulf state flags.
Swords and dagger: The historic weapons utilized by the people of Oman.
funfacts:
The dagger (khanjar) itself is a national symbol of the sultanate, and is still worn by Omani men as a "ceremonial dagger" for formal occasions.
Under a Royal Decree issued in 2004, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry is required to give authorization before any merchandise is allowed to depict the national emblem.

tags: panama white red blue horizontal vertical star
name: Panama
symbolism:
Blue: The Conservative Party.
Red: The Liberal Party.
White: Peace and purity.
Stars: Blue for the purity and honesty of the life of the country, red for the authority and law. Together the stars stand for the new republic.
funfacts: Designed by María de la Ossa de Amador, known as "Mother of the Nation", which was the First Lady of Panama from 1904 to 1908 and a member of the separatist movment which fought for Panamanian independence from Colombia.

tags: peru red white vertical stripes
name: Peru
symbolism:
Red: The blood that was spilled for the fight.
White: Purity and Peace.
funfacts:
The current colors of the Peruvian flag were taken of the design of San Martín (known as "El Libertador of Argentina, Chile and Peru") and Torre Tagle (fifth President of Peru from 1823 to 1824).
The colors red and white are believed to be inspired by the colors of red-and-white flamingos or alternatively red from the flag of Chile and white from the flag of Argentina.

tags: french polynesia red white horizontal stripes waves circle star boat
name: French Polynesia
symbolism:
Red and white: Traditional Polynesian colours.
Canoe: A Tahitian and national traditional symbol.
Five asterisks: The five Archipelagos (the Society Islands, the Tuamotus archipelago, the Gambier Islands, the Austral Islands and the Marquesas).
funfacts: All vessels registered in French Polynesia have to fly the French flag.

tags: papua new guinea red black yellow white triangle star bird animal diagonal
name: Papua New Guinea
symbolism:
Red and black: Traditional colours of many Papua New Guinean tribes as well as the colours of the German Empire who colonised the country prior to 1918.
Bird-of-paradise: Traditional national symbol.
Five stars: The Southern Cross constellation.
funfacts: The design was chosen through a nationwide design competition in 1971. The winning designer was Susan Karike, who was 15 at the time but went largely unrecognised during her lifetime.

tags: philippines blue red white yellow triangle horizontal stripes circle sun star
name: Philippines
symbolism:
Blue: Peace, truth, and justice.
Red: Patriotism and valor.
White triangle: Liberty, equality, and fraternity.
Sun: Unity, freedom, people's democracy and sovereignty.
Eight rays of the sun: Each represents a province with significant involvement in the 1896 Philippine Revolution against Spain.
Three stars: The main three island groups (Luzon, Visayas and Mindanao).
funfacts:
A unique feature of this flag is its usage to indicate a state of war if it is displayed with the red side on top.
According to the 1898 Proclamation of Philippine Independence document, the white triangle signifies the emblem of the Katipunan, the secret society that opposed Spanish rule. It also says the flag's colors commemorate the flag of the United States as a manifestation of gratitude for American aid against the Spanish during the Philippine Revolution.

tags: pakistan green white vertical stripes moon star
name: Pakistan
symbolism:
Green: The Muslim-majority population.
White: The various religious minorities, such as Hindus, Christians, Sikhs, Zoroastrians and others.
Crescent moon and star: Islam, with the crescent moon representing progress and the five-pointed star representing light and knowledge.
funfacts: The flag of Pakistan traces its current form back to a meeting of the Constituent Assembly of Pakistan in 1947, three days before the Partition of British India, when it was adopted by the All-India Muslim League as the official flag-to-be of the Dominion of Pakistan.

tags: poland white red horizontal stripes
name: Poland
symbolism: Red and white: The colours of the coats of arms of the two constituent nations of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, i.e. the White Eagle of Poland and the Pursuer of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania.
funfacts: Similar but unrelated flags are those of Indonesia and Monaco.

tags: saint pierre and miquelon white blue green yellow red black triangle cross boat waves animal
name: Saint Pierre and Miquelon
symbolism:
Ship: Said to be Grande Hermine, which brought Jacques Cartier to Saint Pierre in 1536.
Three square fields: The origin of most inhabitants of the islands, Basques, Bretons, and Normans.
funfacts: The official flag of Saint Pierre and Miquelon is the flag of France.

tags: pitcairn islands blue white red yellow green cross vegetation ribbon british
name: Pitcairn Islands
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Union Jack, see United Kingdom.
Shield with anchor and Bible: The ancestral history of the islanders, most of whom are descended from the sailors who mutinied on the HMS Bounty in 1789.
Green and blue: The island rising from the ocean.
funfacts: Knight helmet, Pitcairn island wheelbarrow and flowering portia tree is of unknown symbolism.

tags: puerto rico red white blue triangle horizontal stripes star
name: Puerto Rico
symbolism:
Red: The blood from the brave warriors.
White stripes: The victory and peace that they would have after gaining independence.
Triangle: The three branches of government.
White star: The island of Puerto Rico.
Blue: The sky and coastal waters.
funfacts: The design was according to some, the result of an optical illusion that Antonio Vélez Alvarado (Puerto Rican journalist, politician and revolutionary) saw in his Manhattan apartment in 1892. He stared at a Cuban flag for a few minutes and after looking at the blank wall the illusion made him perceive the image of the Cuban flag with the colors of the triangle and stripes inverted.

tags: palestine red white green black triangle horizontal stripes pan-arab
name: Palestine
symbolism:
Red (Hashemite dynasty): Courage, bravery, hardiness, strength, and unity.
White (Umayyad dynasty): Cleanliness, honesty, peace, and purity.
Green (Fatimid dynasty): Prosperity, hope, joy, love, and optimism.
Black (Abbasid dynasty): Defeating enemies and strength of mind.
funfacts:
The colors are those used in the Arab Revolt and referred to as the Pan-Arab colours.
Very similar to the flags of Jordan and Western Sahara.

tags: portugal green red vertical stripes circle sphere building shield
name: Portugal
symbolism:
Green: The hope of the nation.
Red: The blood of those who died defending it.
Yellow circle: The armillary sphere, an astronomical and navigational instrument used by the Portuguese sailors.
Shield: Five small blue shields representing the five wounds of Christ while the seven castles refers to the Portuguese victories over their Moorish enemies, under Afonso III, who supposedly captured seven enemy fortresses in the course of his conquest of the Algarve.
funfacts: The red and green colors were not traditionally Portuguese until after the Republican revolution in 1910. The colours were associated with the Portuguese Republican Party and its associated movements. Before that, the portuguese colors were white and blue from the blue cross-on-white banner of King Afonso I.

tags: palau blue yellow circle sun moon
name: Palau
symbolism:
Blue: The Pacific Ocean and the nation's place within it, and also the transition from foreign domination to self-government.
Yellow disc: The full moon which the Palauans consider to be the optimum time for human activity. It is also a symbol of peace, love, and tranquility.
funfacts: While there are some speculations about the flag paying tribute to the Japanese flag and the Palauan-Japanese relations, this has been denied by the designer John Blau Skebong.

tags: paraguay red white blue horizontal stripes circle star vegetation text name
name: Paraguay
symbolism:
Inspired by the colours of the French Tricolour, believed to signify independence and liberty.
Front side emblem is the National coat of arms and says "Republica del Paraguay", Spanish for "Republic of Paraguay".
Reverse side emblem is the Seal of treasury and says "Paz y Justicia", Spanish for "Peace and Justice".
funfacts: The flag is unusual because it differs on its front and reverse sides; the front of the flag shows the national coat of arms, and the reverse shows the seal of the treasury.

tags: qatar white maroon purple triangle tool
name: Qatar
symbolism:
Serrated edge: The nine white points signify Qatar's inclusion as the 9th member of the 'reconciled Emirates' of the Persian Gulf at the conclusion of the Qatari-British treaty in 1916.
Maroon: The history of purple dye in the country dates back several centuries and when the British suggested red for an official flag of the nation the Qatari government rejected it and used a mixture of red and purple instead.
funfacts:
It is very similar to the flag of the neighbouring country Bahrain, which has fewer points, different colour and proportion.
The flag is the only national flag having a width more than twice its height.

tags: réunion reunion red blue yellow triangle building
name: Réunion
symbolism: Volcano: Depicts the volcano "Piton de la Fournaise", French for "Peak of the Furnace", which is a shield volcano on the Réunion island and one of the most active volcanoes in the world.
funfacts: The official flag of Réunion is the flag of France.

tags: romania blue yellow red vertical stripes
name: Romania
symbolism:
Blue: Liberty.
Yellow: Justice.
Red: Fraternity.
funfacts:
It is similar to the flag of Moldova, reflecting the two countries' national and cultural affinity.
The design is also similar to the flags of Andorra and Chad but that is believed to be coincidental.

tags: serbia red blue white fleur-de-lis horizontal stripes bird animal crown cross pan-slavic
name: Serbia
symbolism: Serbian eagle and cross: The national identity of the Serbian people across the centuries.
funfacts:
The Cyrillic C in each corner of the Serbian cross are thought to mean, "Samo sloga Srbina spasava" ("Only unity will save the Serbs").
The colors are the reverse of those on the flag of Russia, and various popular stories exist in Serbia which try to explain why.

tags: russia white blue red horizontal stripes pan-slavic
name: Russia
symbolism:
White: Nobility and frankness.
Blue: Faithfulness, honesty, impeccability and chastity.
Red: Courage, generosity and love.
funfacts: It has its origin in the flag of the Netherlands and was made by simply changing the sequence of stripes.

tags: rwanda blue yellow green horizontal stripes sun circle
name: Rwanda
symbolism:
Blue: Happiness and peace.
Yellow: Economic development.
Green: The hope of prosperity.
Sun: Enlightenment.
funfacts: The previous flag of Rwanda used the Pan-African colors but was replaced (along with the national anthem) because of its strong association with the 1994 genocide.

tags: saudi arabia green white weapon text motto
name: Saudi Arabia
symbolism:
Green: Islam.
Sword: The strictness in applying justice.
funfacts:
The inscription is the Islamic creed, or shahada, written in the calligraphic Thuluth script: "There is no god but Allah; Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah".
Because the shahada is considered holy, the flag is not normally used on T-shirts or other items.

tags: solomon islands blue yellow green white triangle star diagonal
name: Solomon Islands
symbolism:
Blue: The water in the form of rivers, rain, and the Pacific Ocean.
Green: The land, the trees and crops that grow on it.
Yellow: The sun and its rays separating the land and the ocean.
Five stars: The five provinces of the country at the time of independence.
funfacts:
Unlike the flags of nearby Australia, New Zealand, Papua New Guinea, and Samoa, the stars on the flag does not represent the Southern cross.
The design was created by a New Zealander teaching visual arts at the time in the capital Honiara.

tags: seychelles blue yellow red white green triangle pan-african diagonal
name: Seychelles
symbolism:
Slanting bands: A dynamic new country moving into the future.
Blue: The sky and the sea that surrounds the Seychelles.
Yellow: The sun which gives light and life.
Red: The people and their determination to work for the future in unity and love.
White: Social justice and harmony.
Green: The land and natural environment.
funfacts: The colours used in the current flag are the official colours of two of the nation's major political parties: the Seychelles People's United Party and the Seychelles Democratic Party.

tags: sudan red white black green triangle horizontal stripes pan-arab
name: Sudan
symbolism:
Red: Sudan's struggle for independence and the sacrifices of the country's martyrs.
White: The people, light and optimism.
Black: Sudan; in Arabic, "Sudan" means "land of the black people".
Green: Islam, agriculture and the prosperity of the land.
funfacts: The design is based on the Arab Liberation Flag of the Egyptian Revolution of 1952, as are the flags of Egypt, Iraq, Syria, and Yemen. These are known as the Pan-Arab colours.

tags: sweden blue yellow cross
name: Sweden
symbolism:
Cross: Christianity.
Colours are of unknown origin.
funfacts:
Blue and yellow have been used as Swedish colours at least since Magnus III's royal coat of arms of 1275.
Based on the design of the flag of Denmark, the Nordic cross is used in the flags of the nordic countries.

tags: singapore red white horizontal stripes moon star
name: Singapore
symbolism:
Red: Universal brotherhood and equality of man.
White: Pervading and everlasting purity and virtue.
Moon: Young nation on the ascendant.
Five stars: The nation's ideals of "democracy, peace, progress, justice and equality".
funfacts:
The commitee tasked with designing the flag initially wanted the entire background to be red, but the Cabinet decided against this, as red was regarded as a rallying point for communism.
The crescent moon is informally seen by the nation's Muslim activists to represent Islam.
The flag was originally exclusively used on or in front of buildings owned by the government, but rules have been relaxed since then.

tags: saint helena brown blue white red cross british boat flag england animal bird waves
name: Saint Helena
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Union Jack, see United Kingdom.
Bird: The national bird, the Saint Helena plover.
Ship: Coastal scene taken from the colonial seal and shows a with the flag of England.
funfacts: The official flag of Saint Helena is the flag of the United Kingdom.

tags: slovenia white blue red horizontal stripes star mountain pan-slavic
name: Slovenia
symbolism:
Colours: The medieval coat of arms of the Duchy of Carniola (an imperial estate of the Holy Roman Empire).
Mountains: Mount Triglav, Slovenia's highest peak.
Waves: The Adriatic Sea and local rivers.
Stars: Counts of Celje, the great Slovene dynastic house of the late 14th and early 15th century.
funfacts:
The coat of arms was designed by Marko Pogačnik, a Slovenian artist and author.
Without the coat of arms, the flag is identical to the flag of Russia.
The colours are considered to be Pan-Slavic.

tags: svalbard and jan mayen red white blue cross norway
name: Svalbard and Jan Mayen
symbolism: For symbolism regarding the Norwegian flag, see Norway.
funfacts: While Svalbard does not have its own flag, one was proposed in 1930 which depicts the lion of the Norwegian coat of arms against a background of the Arctic archipelago.

tags: slovakia white blue red horizontal stripes cross mountain pan-slavic
name: Slovakia
symbolism:
Double cross: Slovak national symbol and Christianity which originated in the Byzantine (Eastern Roman) Empire in the 9th century.
Mountains: The three mountain ranges Tatra, Matra and Fatra.
Red in the coat of arms: The Slovak martyrdom during the time of Magyarisation.
funfacts:
The coat of arms was designed by Ladislav Čisárik, a Slovak painter and heraldic artist, and Ladislav Vrtel, an expert in heraldry.
Without the coat of arms, the flag is identical to the flag of Russia.
The colours are considered to be Pan-Slavic.

tags: sierra leone green white blue horizontal stripes
name: Sierra Leone
symbolism:
Green: The country's natural resources, specifically agriculture and its mountains.
White: Unity and justice.
Blue: The hope of contributing to world peace through the usage of the natural harbour of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone.
funfacts: The flag is used as a flag of convenience by foreign merchant vessels. The minimum enforcement of admiralty law on such vessels has led to illegal and suspicious activity.

tags: san marino white blue horizontal stripes vegetation mountain crown ribbon cross text motto building
name: San Marino
symbolism:
White: Peace.
Blue: Liberty.
Towers: The three citadels of San Marino (La Guaita, La Cesta and La Montale).
Hills: The three summits of Monte Titano.
Oak and laurel branch: The stability of the republic and the defense of the liberty.
Crown: Sovereignty.
funfacts: The ribbon says "Libertas", Italian for "Liberty", and refers to the taking in of victims of political persecution in the earlier years of San Marino.

tags: senegal green yellow red vertical stripes star pan-african
name: Senegal
symbolism:
Green: Islam, hope and fecundity.
Yellow: Wealth, the product of work and the colour of arts, literature, and intellect.
Red: Blood, life and the sacrifice accepted by the nation as well as the strong determination to fight against underdevelopment.
Star: The five points of the star recall the human ideogram in the center of the flag of the former Mali Federation.
funfacts:
The design is inspired by the flag of France.
The colours are the colours of the Pan-Africanist movement and is a sign of unity among African countries.

tags: somalia blue white star
name: Somalia
symbolism:
Blue: The sky as well as the Gulf of Aden, Guardafui Channel and the Somali Sea.
Five-pointed star: Known as the Star of Unity and represents the areas where the Somali ethnic group has traditionally resided; Djibouti, Somaliland, the Somali region in Ethiopia, the North Eastern Province in Kenya, and Somalia.
funfacts:
Designed by Mohammed Awale Liban, a Somali scholar nationalist who served in all Somali governments up until 1964.
The flag is strictly prohibited in Somaliland, an unrecognised sovereign state internationally considered to be part of Somalia.

tags: suriname green white red yellow horizontal stripes star
name: Suriname
symbolism:
Red: Progress and hope.
White: Freedom, justice and independence.
Green: The fertility of the land.
Yellow star: Unity and a golden future, while the five points of the star represent the ethnic groups of East-Indians, Africans, Chinese, Europeans and Amerindians.
funfacts: The first national flag of Suriname was designed to represent the diversity of the people and contained five different coloured stars; black (African), brown (Indians), yellow (Javanese and Chinese), red (American Indians), and white (Europeans). However, the flag was criticized by the wider public for putting too much emphasis on the ethnic differences and therefore symbolizing less of the national unity of the Surinamese people.

tags: south sudan black blue red green yellow white triangle horizontal stripes star pan-african
name: South Sudan
symbolism:
Black: The people of South Sudan.
Red: The blood that was shed for the independence of the country.
Green: The country's agricultural and natural wealth, land, as well as progress.
White: The peace attained after many years of the liberation struggle.
Blue: The Nile River, a source of life for the country.
Yellow star: Represents unity (of the states), hope, and determination for all people.
funfacts:
The flag is older than the country itself, as the flag was adopted in 2005, while the country became independent in 2011.
Similar to the flags of neighbouring countries Sudan and Kenya, using the symbolism of the Pan-African movement.

tags: são tomé and príncipe sao tome principe green yellow red black triangle horizontal stripes star pan-african
name: São Tomé and Príncipe
symbolism:
Green: The plentiful vegetation of the country.
Yellow: The tropical sun and cocoa, a key agricultural crop for the nation.
Red: Equality and the struggle for independence.
Stars: The two islands that make up the country.
funfacts: The flag is coloured in the popular Pan-African colours of the Ethiopian flag, reflecting both a break with the country's colonial past and its unity with other African ex-colonies.

tags: el salvador blue white horizontal stripes vegetation mountain hat text motto name flag
name: El Salvador
symbolism:
Blue: The skies of the country and the two massive oceans of Central America.
White: Peace, concordia and solidarity with the world.
Triangle: The three branches of the country's government: Executive, Legislative and Judiciary.
Five volcanoes: The fellowship of the five original isthmian member states of the United Provinces of Central America.
Phrygian cap on a staff: Freedom, inspired by the symbolism in the American and French Revolutions.
funfacts:
The proportion is specified as 189:335 which is close to 9:16.
The ribbon has the national motto written on it: Dios Unión Libertad (Spanish for "God Union Liberty").
One of only seven flags which shows a flag of itself.

tags: sint maarten blue red white yellow triangle horizontal stripes animal vegetation text motto ribbon building
name: Sint Maarten
symbolism:
Red: Solidarity and courage.
Blue: Peace and assurance of pardon.
White: Purity and faith.
The Coat of arms contains several national symbols; the courthouse, the border monument, the national flower (orange-yellow sage) and national bird (the pelican).
funfacts:
Designed by 17 year old resident Roselle Richardson, her submission was picked in a competition of 115 entries.
The ribbon in the coat of arms has the Sint Maarten motto written on it: Semper pro grediens (Latin for "always progressing").

tags: syria red white blue green horizontal stripes star pan-arab
name: Syria
symbolism:
Red (Hashemite dynasty): Courage, bravery, hardiness, strength, and unity.
White (Umayyad dynasty): Cleanliness, honesty, peace, and purity.
Green (Fatimid dynasty): Prosperity, hope, joy, love, and optimism.
Black (Abbasid dynasty): Defeating enemies and strength of mind.
funfacts:
Although Syria is not part of any Arab state union, the flag of the United Arab Republic was readopted to show Syria's commitment to Arab unity.
The colors are those used in the Arab Revolt and referred to as the Pan-Arab colours.

tags: eswatini swaziland blue yellow red white black shield weapon horizontal stripes
name: Eswatini
symbolism:
Red: Past battles.
Blue: Peace and stability
Yellow: The resources of the country.
Nguni shield and two spears:Protection from the country's enemies. Its colour is meant to show that white and black people live in peaceful coexistence in Eswatini.
funfacts: From the shield and spears hang injobo tassels, feathers of the widowbird and the lourie. These feathers are used only by the king.

tags: turks and caicos islands blue white red yellow cross british animal vegetation
name: Turks and Caicos Islands
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Union Jack, see United Kingdom.
Coat of arms: The conch shell and lobster represents the islands' primary industry of fishing while the Melocactus symbolises the territory's biome.
funfacts: The Melocactus, which is visually similar to the traditional Turkish fez, give the islands the first half of their name.

tags: chad blue yellow red vertical stripes pan-african
name: Chad
symbolism:
Blue: The sky and hope.
Yellow: The sun and desert.
Red: The bloodshed over independence.
funfacts:
The design was intended to be a combination of the colours of blue, white and red as seen on the flag of France with the Pan-African colours of green, yellow and red.
It is similar to the flags of Andorra, Romania and Moldova.

tags: french southern and antarctic lands red white blue star vertical stripes text
name: French Southern and Antarctic Lands
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the flag of France, see France.
Five stars: The administrative districts that make up the territory; Adélie Land, Crozet Islands, Kerguelen Islands, Saint Paul & Amsterdam Islands and the Scattered Islands in the Indian Ocean.
funfacts: The letters "TAAF" in the monogram comes from the French name of the territory; "Terres australes et antarctiques françaises".

tags: togo green yellow red white horizontal stripes star pan-african
name: Togo
symbolism:
Red: Blood shed by Martyrs to gain independence.
White star: Hope.
Green: The forests, agriculture, nature, and overall hope for the future.
Yellow: The natural resources of the country.
funfacts:
Designed by Togolese artist Paul Ahyi.
The proportions are specified as the golden ratio φ ≈ 1.618034, making the flag of Togo one out of the only two national flags with irrational proportions (the other being Nepal).
The flag is coloured in the popular Pan-African colours of the Ethiopian flag, reflecting both a break with the country's colonial past and its unity with other African ex-colonies.

tags: thailand red white blue horizontal stripes
name: Thailand
symbolism:
Red: The land and people.
White: Religions.
Blue: Monarchy.
funfacts: Legend says that during a flood, King Vajiravudh (Rama VI) saw the flag hanging upside-down. To prevent this from happening again he created a new flag which was symmetrical.

tags: tajikistan red white green horizontal stripes star crown
name: Tajikistan
symbolism:
Red: The unity of the nation as well as victory and sunrise.
White: Purity, morality, the snow and ice of the mountains as well as cotton.
Green: The generosity of nature, fertile valleys, the religion of Islam, and the celebration of Nowruz (Iranian New Year).
Crown: The Samanid dynasty and Tajik people, as the name Tajik is connected with Persian tâj, "crown", in popular etymology.
Seven stars: The number seven in Tajik traditional legends represents perfection and happiness.
funfacts: Other interpretations of the colours state that the flag symbolically unifies the people of Tajik society, with the red stripe representing the manual labour class, the white stripe representing the intellectual worker class, and the green representing the agricultural class living in Tajikistan's rural or mountainous regions.

tags: tokelau blue yellow white triangle star boat
name: Tokelau
symbolism:
Boat: A Polynesian canoe representing the journey towards finding the best governance structure for its people.
Stars: The Southern cross constellation used as a guide and also the three main islands as well as Swains Island (administered by the United States but claimed by Tokelau).
funfacts: The positions of the stars was changed in 2007, previously showing a representation of the geographic location of the islands.

tags: timor-leste east timor red yellow black white triangle star
name: Timor-Leste (East Timor)
symbolism:
Yellow: The traces of colonialism in East Timor's history.
Black: The obscurantism that needs to be overcome.
Red: The struggle for national liberation.
Star: The light that guides.
White: Peace.
funfacts: Adopted for the first time in 1975 when the country declared its independence from Portugal, just nine days before being invaded by Indonesia.

tags: turkmenistan green red vertical stripe carpet moon star vegetation
name: Turkmenistan
symbolism:
Green: Historically associated with the people of Turkmenistan.
Red stripe: The country's famous carpet industry, with five traditional designs representing the major tribes and houses.
Moon: Islam and the hope of the country for a shining future.
Five stars: The five provinces (welayatlar) of Turkmenistan; Ahal, Balkan, Dashoguz, Lebap and Mary.
Crossed olive branches: The status of permanent neutrality and the peace-loving nature of the Turkmen people.
funfacts: The five traditional carpet designs in the red stripe make the flag of Turkmenistan the most complex national flag design in the world.

tags: tunisia red white circle star
name: Tunisia
symbolism:
Red: The blood of martyrs killed during the Crusades before the advent of the Ottomans on 1574.
White: Peace.
Disk: The radiance of the nation as the sun.
Crescent and five-pointed star: Unity of all Muslims and the Five Pillars of Islam.
funfacts: The red crescent and the five-pointed star, two ancient symbols of Islam, were most notably used on the flag of the Ottoman Empire and have since appeared on many flags of Islamic countries.

tags: tonga red white cross
name: Tonga
symbolism:
Red: The sacrifice of the Blood of Christ, which he shed during his Crucifixion.
White: Purity.
Red cross: Christianity.
funfacts:
The Tongan constitution stipulates that the national flag can never be changed.
It has some similarities with the flags of Switzerland and Georgia.
The previous Tongan flag was a centered red cross on a white field. It was later changed because it was almost identical to the emblem of the International Red Cross.

tags: turkey red white moon star
name: Turkey
symbolism: Crescent and five-pointed star: Unity of all Muslims and the Five Pillars of Islam.
funfacts: The current design of the Turkish flag is directly derived from the late Ottoman flag.

tags: trinidad tobago red white black triangle stripes diagonal
name: Trinidad and Tobago
symbolism:
Red: Fire (the sun and courage).
Black: Earth (dedication).
White: Water (purity and equality).
funfacts: Designed by Carlisle Chang, an artist considered the father of Trinidad Art.

tags: tuvalu blue red white yellow cross british star
name: Tuvalu
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Union Jack, see United Kingdom.
Stars: The nine islands which comprise Tuvalu.
funfacts:
The arrangement of the stars is geographically correct, but with the east towards the top (i.e. north to the left).
In 1995 the flag was updated to show only eight stars to reflect the name "Tuvalu" meaning "eight standing together" and refers to the eight inhabited islands. However, due pressure from the public, the ninth star was reinstated in 1997.

tags: taiwan red blue white circle sun
name: Taiwan
symbolism:
Blue sky with white sun: The emblem of the political party Kuomintang with the rays representing progress.
Red: The blood of the revolutionaries who sacrificed themselves in order to overthrow the Qing dynasty.
funfacts:
The flag is also known as "Blue Sky, White Sun, and a Wholly Red Earth".
Public display of the flag is outlawed for public use in mainland China, except for historical uses inside historical places.

tags: tanzania green yellow black blue triangle stripes diagonal
name: Tanzania
symbolism:
Green: The natural vegetation and rich agricultural resources of the country.
Black: The Swahili people who are native to Tanzania.
Blue: The Indian Ocean, as well as the nation's numerous lakes and rivers.
Yellow: Mineral wealth and the rich deposits in the land.
funfacts:
It is one of a relatively small number of national flags incorporating a diagonal line.
Designed as a combination of the flags from the nations that united to form Tanzania; Tanganyika and Zanzibar.

tags: ukraine blue yellow horizontal stripes
name: Ukraine
symbolism:
Blue: Water and alternatively the Dnieper river.
Yellow: Fire and alternatively the golden domes (cupolas) of Christian churches.
funfacts:
The earliest known reference of the source of the colours are from pre-Christian times, during the 15th century.
In the early 20th century, the flag was yellow on top and blue on the bottom. Hence the alternative symbolism of the river running underneath churches.

tags: uganda black yellow red horizontal stripes circle bird animal
name: Uganda
symbolism:
Bird: The national bird of Uganda (the Grey crowned crane) and the raised leg is a symbol of the forward movement of the country.
Black: The Native ethnic groups of Africa.
Yellow: Africa's sunshine.
Red: African brotherhood, the blood of all Africans.
funfacts: The crane emblem was selected by the British colonial authorities as a way of promoting unity between the traditional kingdoms in Uganda.

tags: united states minor outlying islands red white blue horizontal stripes star
name: United States Minor Outlying Islands
symbolism: For symbolism regarding the Star-Spangled Banner, see United States.
funfacts: The official flag is that of the United States.

tags: usa united states america red white blue horizontal stripes star
name: United States
symbolism:
White: Purity and innocence.
Red: Hardiness and valor.
Blue: Vigilance, perseverance and justice.
Stars: The 50 states of the United States of America.
Stripes: The thirteen British colonies that declared independence from the Kingdom of Great Britain, and became the first states in the U.S.
funfacts:
Also known as the Star-Spangled Banner (as mentioned in the national anthem) or Stars and Stripes.
If a new U.S. state were to be admitted (like District of Columbia or Puerto Rico), it would require a new design of the flag to add a star for the 51st state.
However, according to the U.S. Army Institute of Heraldry, the United States flag never becomes obsolete. Any approved American flag may continue to be used and displayed until no longer serviceable.

tags: uruguay white blue horizontal stripes sun face
name: Uruguay
symbolism:
Stripes: The nine original departments of Uruguay (reduced to four stripes because of visibility).
Sun: The Sun of May which represents the May Revolution of 1810 and Inti, the sun god and mythological founder of the Incan Empire.
funfacts:
Designed by Joaquín Suárez, a Uruguayan political figure.
The flag above is one of three official flags of Uruguay.
The Sun of May is also found on the flag of Argentina.

tags: uzbekistan blue white green red horizontal stripes moon star
name: Uzbekistan
symbolism:
Blue: The sky and clear water. It is also the colour of the Turkic peoples.
White: Peace and good luck.
Green: Nature, new life, and good harvest.
Red: The power of life.
Moon: Islam, and the birth of a new nation.
Stars: Spirituality and divinity as well as a symbol of the pursuit of perfection and happiness of the Uzbek people in their homeland.
funfacts:
Partly inspired by the flag of the Uzbek Soviet Socialist Republic.
Uzbekistan became the first of the newly independent republics previously a part of the Soviet Union in Central Asia to choose a new flag.
Shares some elements with the flag of Lesotho.

tags: vatican city yellow white vertical stripes crown
name: Vatican City
symbolism:
Crown: The papal tiara, a crown worn by popes of the Catholic Church until 1963.
Two keys: The keys of heaven given by Jesus Christ to St Peter. Gold represents spiritual power, while the silver key represents worldly power.
funfacts:
It is displayed in many Catholic churches worldwide, often alongside the national flag of where the church is located.
It is one of only two square sovereign-state flags, the other being the flag of Switzerland.

tags: saint vincent grenadines blue yellow green vertical stripes
name: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
symbolism:
V: The first letter of the country's name, and its nickname as the "Gems of the Antilles".
Blue: The sky and the sea.
Yellow: The colour of the islands' sand, the sunshine, and the "bright spirit" of the islanders.
Green: The country's plentiful vegetation, as well as the vitality of Vincentians.
funfacts:
The flag is utilised as a flag of convenience by foreign merchant vessels and offers many advantages for the ships, such as less expensive fees and lax rules regarding crew, safety, and the environment but this naturally attracts illegal and suspicious activities.
The swiss graphic artist Julien van der Wal was tasked with modernizing the flag and created the V symbol of diamonds which replaced the coat of arms consisting of a breadfruit leaf.

tags: venezuela yellow blue red horizontal stripes star
name: Venezuela
symbolism:
Yellow: The riches of the country, the wealth of Venezuelan soil, gold, sovereignty, harmony, justice and agriculture, as well as the Sun.
Blue: The Sea of the Caribbean that surrounds the country, as well as the Venezuelan beaches.
Red: The spilled blood in the battle of independence from Spain.
Stars: The seven provinces of Venezuela that signed the declaration of independence (Caracas, Cumaná, Barcelona, Barinas, Margarita, Mérida and Trujillo) and Guayana.
funfacts:
The flag is essentially the one designed by Francisco de Miranda for his unsuccessful 1806 expedition to liberate Venezuela and later adopted by the National Congress of 1811. This is also the inspiration for the flags of Colombia and Ecuador.
Alternative symbolism for the flag is that the "golden" America is separated from the bloody Spain by the deep blue sea.

tags: british virgin islands white blue red green yellow cross human text motto ribbon shield
name: British Virgin Islands
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Union Jack, see United Kingdom.
Person and oil lamps: Saint Ursula, the patron saint of the Virgin Islands, with her 11.000 virgin followers which the islands are named after by Christopher Columbus.
funfacts: The ribbon has the motto of the islands on it in Latin; "Vigilate" meaning "be vigilant".

tags: united states virgin islands white blue yellow red animal bird vegetation weapon shield text vertical stripes
name: United States Virgin Islands
symbolism:
Eagle: A simplified version of the coat of arms of the United States.
Laurel: Victory.
Arrows: The three major islands that make up the U.S. Virgin Islands: Saint Croix, Saint Thomas, and Saint John.
V I: Abbreviating the Virgin Islands.
funfacts: The design came to be when the governor of the islands approached the captain of the USS Grebe (a minesweeper ship) and the cartoonist Percival Wilson Sparks for suggestions. Sparks asked his wife and sister to embroider the design and this became the flag of U.S. Virgin Islands.

tags: vietnam red yellow star
name: Vietnam
symbolism:
Red: Revolution and bloodshed.
Star: The five main classes in Vietnamese society; workers, farmers, soldiers, intellectuals, and entrepreneurs.
funfacts: Although the flag was not representing Vietnam until 1945 it was designed in 1940 and used during an uprising against the French in southern Vietnam as well as by the Viet Minh, a communist-led organization created in 1941 to oppose Japanese occupation.

tags: vanuatu red green yellow black triangle vegetation horizontal
name: Vanuatu
symbolism:
Green: The richness of the islands.
Red: Blood which unites humanity as humans.
Black: The ni-Vanuatu people.
Yellow Y-shape: The shape of Vanuatu islands on the map and the light of the gospel going through the pattern of the islands in the Pacific Ocean.
Emblem: A boar's tusk representing customs and tradition but also prosperity, and two leaves of the local namele tree which represents peace.
funfacts:
The Prime Minister of Vanuatu, Father Walter Lini, requested the inclusion of yellow and black lines to make the black stand out.
The design is very similar to the flag of South Africa.
The origin of the design is a similar flag adopted by the political party Vanua'aku Pati which led the New Hebrides (now Vanuatu) to independence in 1980.

tags: wallis and futuna red blue white triangle vertical stripes cross
name: Wallis and Futuna
symbolism:
For symbolism regarding the Tricolour, see France.
Red: Courage.
White: Purity of ideals.
Triangles: The three native kings of the islands, and the French administrator.
funfacts: The official flag of Wallis and Futuna is the flag of France.

tags: samoa red blue white star
name: Samoa
symbolism:
Red: Courage.
Blue: Freedom and justice.
White: Purity.
Stars: The Southern cross constellation representing the Southern Hemisphere.
funfacts:
The design is similar to the flag of Taiwan but believed to be designed independently.
Other flags displaying the Southern cross are for example Australia, New Zealand and Papua New Guinea.

tags: kosovo blue yellow white star map
name: Kosovo
symbolism:
Stars: Kosovo's six major ethnic groups; Albanians, Serbs, Bosniaks, Turks, Romani, and Gorani.
Map: Stylized layout of the country.
funfacts:
The flag design emerged from an international competition, organized by the United Nations-backed Kosovo Unity Team, which attracted almost one thousand entries.
One of only a few other flags with a map of the country on them, others are for example Cyprus and Christmas Island.
Both the Serbian and Albanian flags are common in Kosovo as they are used as ethnic flags for Serbians and Kosovo Albanians respectively.

tags: yemen red white black horizontal stripes pan-arab
name: Yemen
symbolism:
Red: Unity and the bloodshed of martyrs.
White: A bright future.
Black: The dark past.
funfacts:
The flag is essentially the Arab Liberation Flag of 1952, introduced after the Egyptian Revolution, which is using the Pan-Arab colours.
Other flags based on the Arab Liberation Flag are those of Egypt, Iraq, Sudan and Syria.

tags: mayotte white red blue yellow grey text name ribbon animal vegetation moon star
name: Mayotte
symbolism:
Blue and red: The Flag of France.
Seahorses: A reference to the shape of the main island.
Moon: Islam, the main religion of Mayotte.
Yellow flowers: Ylang-ylang flowers which represent the main agricultural resource on the island.
funfacts:
The official flag of Mayotte is the flag of France.
Designed by Michel Chabin (former director of the Reunion Archives) and painted by local artist Pascale Santerre.
The ribbon displays the Mayotte motto, "Ra Hachiri", which is Shimaore for "We are vigilant".

tags: south africa red gren blue white yellow black triangle horizontal pan-african
name: South Africa
symbolism:
The South African government says that "no universal symbolism should be attached to any of the colours".
The Y shape: The convergence of diverse elements within South African society, taking the road ahead in unity.
funfacts:
The origins of the colours black, green and gold are from the flag of the African National Congress while the red, white and blue comes from the flag of Netherlands.
When adopted, it was the only national flag in the world to have six colours in its design (without a coat of arms).
Designed by Fred Brownell (South African state herald) who also designed the flag of Namibia.

tags: zambia green red black orange bird animal vertical stripes pan-african
name: Zambia
symbolism:
Green: The country's natural resources and vegetation.
Red: The struggle for freedom.
Black: The population of the country.
Orange: Mineral wealth (primarily copper).
Bird: The people's ability to rise above the nation's problems.
funfacts: The bird is an African fish eagle, the national bird of Zambia, Namibia and Zimbabwe.

tags: zimbabwe green yellow red black white horizontal stripes star bird animal pan-african
name: Zimbabwe
symbolism:
Green: The agriculture and rural areas.
Yellow: The wealth of minerals in the country, primarily gold.
Red: The blood shed during the first and second Chimurenga (wars) in the "struggle for independence".
Black: The heritage, race and ethnicity of the black majority.
White: Peace.
Bird: The history of Zimbabwe.
Red star: The nation's aspirations and the revolutionary struggle for freedom and peace.
funfacts:
The design is based on the flag of Zimbabwe's ruling party, the Zimbabwe African National Union - Patriotic Front.
The bird is known as a Zimbabwe Bird, it is the national emblem of Zimbabwe and representing a statue found at the ruins of the medieval city of Great Zimbabwe.
The flag is coloured in the popular Pan-African colours of the Ethiopian flag, reflecting both a break with the country's colonial past and its unity with other African ex-colonies.
